gurmukhi: hwr rhy rnDIr sBY Ab kw pRB jU qumry mn AwXo ]Bwgq pY gn so rn qy iqr so hmro su kCU n bswXo ]1653]
transliteration: Haar Rahe Randheer Sabhai Ab Kaa Prabh Joo Toumre Man Aayo|| Bhaagad Pai Gad So Ran Te Tih So Hamro Su Kachhaadna Basaayo||1653||
translation: “All the warriors are being defeated; O Lord ! what is in your mind now, that you want to do? Now all the warriors are running away and we have no control over them now.”1653.

gurmukhi: rudR qy Awid ijqy gn dyv iqqy imil kY niRp aUpr Dwey ]qy sB Awvq dyK blI Dnu qwn kY bwn hkwir lgwey ]
transliteration: Rudra Te Aadd(i) Jite Gad Dev Title Mil(i) Kai Nrip Oopar Dhaae|| Te Sabh Aavat Dekh Balidhan(u) Taan Kai Baan Hadaar(i) Lagade||
translation: All the ganas of Rudra etc., who were there and all other gods who were there, they all together fell upon the king Kharag Singh; seeing them all coming, this mighty warrior challenged all of them by pulling his bow;

gurmukhi: eyk igry qh Gwiel hÍY iek qRws Bry qij ju`Du prwey ]eyk lry n fry blvwn indwn soaU niRp mwr igrwey ]1654]
transliteration: Ek Gire Tah Ghaail Hvai Ik Traas Bhare Taj(i) Juddh(u) Paraae|| Ek Dare Na Darre Blavaan Nidaan Sooo Nrip Maar Giraae||1654||
translation: Some of them, who were wounded, fell down and some becoming fearful ran away; the warriors who fought fearlessly, were ultimately killed by the king.1654.

gurmukhi: jIq suryS DnyS KgyS gnyS ko Gwiel kY murCwXo ]BUm prXo ibsMBwir inhwr jlyS idnyS insyS prwXo ]
transliteration: Jeet Suresh Dhanesh Khagesh Gadesh Ko Ghaail Kai Murchhaado Bhoom Daryo Bisanbdaar(i) Nihaar Jalesh Dinesh Nisesh Paraayo||
translation: After gaining victory over Surya, Kuber, Garuda etc., the king wounded Ganesh and made him unconscious; seeing Ganesh fallen on the ground, Varuna, Surya and Chandrama fled away;

gurmukhi: bIr mhyS qy Awidk Bwj gey ieh swmuih eyk n AwXo ]kop kiRpwiniD Awvq jo su cpyt so mwr kY BUim igrwXo ]1655]
transliteration: Beer Mahesh Te Aadik Bhaaj Gad Eh Saamuh(i) Ek Na Aayo|| Kop Kridaanidh(i) Aavat Jo Su Chapet So Maar Kai Bhoom(i) Giraayo||1655||
translation: The hero like Shiva also went away and did not come before the king; whosoever came before the king, getting enraged, the king caused him to fall down on the ground with the blow of his hand.1655.

gurmukhi: sRI hir isau hir ey khI bwq Dnm ky qwq ]iqhI smY iSvjU khXo bHmy isau muskwq ]1656]
transliteration: Srihar(i) Sio Har(i) E Kahibaat Dharam Ke Taat|| Tihisamai Shivjoo Kahyo Brahme Sio Mouskaat||1656||
translation: Brahma said to Krishna, “You are the master of Dharma;” and at the same time Shiva said to Brahma, smilingly;1656.

gurmukhi: Awpn so sB hI Bt jUJ rhY kr kY n mrY niRp mwrXo ]qau cqurwnn isau iSv jU kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Oopan So Sabh Hibhat Joojh Rahai Kar Kai Na Darai Nrip Mdaryo|| Tau Chaturaanan Sio Shiv Joo Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant|| Tau Chaturaanan Sio Shiv Joo Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo||
translation: “Many mighty warriors like us have fought heroically with the king, but none has been able to kill him;” then Shiva said further to Brahma:

gurmukhi: skR jmwidk bIr ijqy hmhUM ien so Aiq hI rn pwrXo ]eyqo nhI bl hwrq rMck caudhUM lokin ko dlu hwrXo ]1657]
transliteration: Sakra Jamaadik Beer Jite Ham-hoon In So At(i) Ran Pdaryo|| Eto Nahibal Haarat Ranchak Chaudahoon Lokan(i) Ko Dal(u) Hdaryo||1657||
translation: “Indra, Yama and all of us have waged a dreadful war with the king; the army of the fourteen worlds has been dreaded, but the power of the king has not even slightly declined.”1657.

gurmukhi: doaU krq ibcwr ieq pMkj pUq qiRnYn ]auq riv Asqwcil gXo ss pRgtXo BeI rYn ]1658]
transliteration: Dooo Karat Bichaar It Panndaj Poot Trinain|| Out Rav(i) Astaachal(i) Gado Sas Pragtyo Bhairain||1658||
translation: In this way, Brahma and Shiva are holding consultation on this side and on the other side, the sun set, the moon arose and night fell.1658.
